docs.snippet: BUENOS AIRES, June 8-- The Commanders in Chief of Argentina's Army, Navy and Air Force announced today that Lieut. Gen. Juan Carlos Ongania had been deposed as President and that they were taking over the Government.
docs.lead_paragraph: BUENOS AIRES, June 8-- The Commanders in Chief of Argentina's Army, Navy and Air Force announced today that Lieut. Gen. Juan Carlos Ongania had been deposed as President and that they were taking over the Government.
docs.abstract: Sworn in as provisional leader along with 2 other mil comdrs after deposing Pres Ongania

headline.main: ARGENTINE CHIEF IS FORCED TO QUIT IN MILITARY COUP; After Barricading Himself in Mansion, Ongania Drives to Army Base to Resign 3-MAN JUNTA SWORN IN Commanders Say Take-over Is to Meet Challenges by Groups of Terrorists Argentine President Is Forced To Resign by Military Leaders

docs.snippet: BUENOS AIRES--The rule of the strongman in Latin America, once thought to be on the decline, seems more pervasive than ever.
docs.lead_paragraph: BUENOS AIRES--The rule of the strongman in Latin America, once thought to be on the decline, seems more pervasive than ever.
docs.abstract: Article on failure of democracy and persistence of dictatorship in Latin Amer; US position relative to situation discussed; question is whether US should work towards establishment of liberal constitutionalism; repts of police excesses, including torture of pol prisoners, which has reached epidemic proportions, and censorship discussed; persistence of dictatorship linked to fedual traditions derived from Spanish and Portuguese heritage and fragmented legal system derived from Napoleonic Code

headline.main: The Outlook for Latin America: Persistence of Strongman Rule; The Outlook in Latin America: Persistence of Strongman Rule

keywords.value: AMERICAN NATIONS AND WESTERN HEMISPHERE POSSESSIONS

byline.original: By MALCOLM W. BROWNE Special to The New York Times

docs.snippet: As the World Cup soccer tournament moves toward the quarterfinals, the outcome of each game becomes more important and the game of "let's suppose" more popular.
docs.lead_paragraph: As the World Cup soccer tournament moves toward the quarterfinals, the outcome of each game becomes more important and the game of "let's suppose" more popular.

headline.main: 10 SOCCER TEAMS ARE STILL KICKING; Five Quarterfinal Berths in World Cup Undecided

docs.snippet: MEXICO CITY, June 10 (AP)  Gerhard Muller, a center forward, scored three goals for the second time in the World Soccer Cup championship and led his team to a 3-1 victory over Peru today to assure the West Germans of top place in Group IV.
docs.lead_paragraph: MEXICO CITY, June 10 (AP) Gerhard Muller, a center forward, scored three goals for the second time in the World Soccer Cup championship and led his team to a 3-1 victory over Peru today to assure the West Germans of top place in Group IV.

headline.main: MULLER'S 3 GOALS DEFEAT PERU, 3- Pete's 2 Tallies Help Brazil Top Rumania Uruguay and El Salvador Beaten

docs.snippet: MEXICO CITY, June 11 (AP) The Mexican soccer team gained the World Cup quarterfinals tonight for the first time. The host nation beat Belgium, 1-0, before 112,000 fans in Aztec Stadium to tie the Soviet Union for first place in Group I.
docs.lead_paragraph: MEXICO CITY, June 11 (AP) The Mexican soccer team gained the World Cup quarterfinals tonight for the first time. The host nation beat Belgium, 1-0, before 112,000 fans in Aztec Stadium to tie the Soviet Union for first place in Group I.

headline.main: MEXICO, ENGLAND SCORE IN SOCCER; Win 1-0 Games Italy Also Gains World Quarterfinals
